About Me

I am a Ph.D. student at the Theoretical Materials Design Lab. in Kwansei Gakuin University, and working with Prof.Katsunori Wakabayashi from April 2024. Our research target is to reveal the peculiar electronic, magnetic and transport properties in nano-carbon materials such as graphene, nano-graphene, graphene nanoribbons, nanotubes using theoretical and/or computation method.

Projects

Topological edge states induced by Zak’s phase in A3B monolayers

2018 - 2019

I have focused the theoretical materials design of A3B atomic sheet, which possess the edge localized states from the viewpoint of topological Zak’s phase. The main part of the thesis has been published in Phys. Rev. B (2019).

Published

[1] Topological edge states induced by Zak’s phase in A3B monolayers.

Physical Review B 99, 075426 (2019).

Conference Presentation

[1] T. Kameda, F. Liu, K. Wakabayashi, Topological Edge States Induced by Zak’s phase in A3B Monolayers

31st International Micro processes and Nanotechnology Conference, Sapporo Park Hotel, Sapporo, Japan, November 16, 2019.

[2] T. Kameda, F. Liu, K. Wakabayashi, Topological Edge States Induced by Zak’s phase in A3B Monolayers

56th The Fullerenes, Nanotubes and Graphene Research Society Symposium, The University of Tokyo, Japan, March 4, 2019

[3] T. Kameda, F. Liu, K. Wakabayashi, Theoretical Analysis of Electronic States and Topological Properties of Two-Dimensional C3N Atomic Films

73rd Annual Meeting of the Physical Society of Japan, Tokyo University of Science, March 22, 2018.
